attributes.text:
website List Controller

General idea The list controller is responsible for synchronizing data given as model to a DOM element. As definition for a single item, templates are used. More details on templates can be found in {@link qx.bom.Template}.

Features

  • Synchronize the model and the target
  • Filtering

Usage

As model, {@link qx.data.Array}s and plain JavaScript Arrays work. As a Target, you have to use a DOM element e.g. a plain DIV element. Make sure you have the template you are referencing in the DOM.
The mode which can either be a native array or a qooxdoo data list. Maps to the model property.
A DOM element which should is the target for the generation.
The id of the template.
Fired on change of the property {@link #delegate}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #model}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #target}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #templateId}.
Responsible for removing all items from the target element.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property delegate.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #delegate}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property model.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property target.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #target}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #templateId}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property delegate.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #delegate}.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #target}.

Initial value for property delegate.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property delegate with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #delegate}.
the default value
Initial value for property model.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property model with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
the default value
Initial value for property target.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property target with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #target}.
the default value
Initial value for property templateId.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property templateId with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #templateId}.
the default value

Resets the user value of the property delegate.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #delegate}.

Resets the user value of the property model.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

Resets the user value of the property target.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #target}.

Resets the user value of the property templateId.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #templateId}.
New value for property delegate.

Sets the user value of the property delegate.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #delegate}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property model.

Sets the user value of the property model.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property target.

Sets the user value of the property target.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #target}.

Sets the user value of the property templateId.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #templateId}.
The unmodified incoming value.

This is the main method which will take the data from the model and push it to the target view. If you are using a plain Array as model, you need to call that method every time you want to see the changed model in the view while using {@link qx.data.Array}s will do that automatically for you. This method also attaches to every created DOM element the model object which was used to create it at .$model.
The delegate for the list controller which supports almost all methods documented in {@link qx.data.controller.IControllerDelegate} except bindItem.
Array containing the data which should be shown in the list.
The target DOM node which should show the data.
The id of the template which should be use. Check out {@link qx.bom.Template} for details on templating.
